meanings.definition: The area behind a movie studio where outdoor scenes are filmed.
meanings.sent1: The crew set up the cameras on the backlots for the outdoor scene.
meanings.sent2: The actors enjoyed filming on the backlots under the open sky.
meanings.sent3: The director joked that the backlots were their own little outdoor paradise.
meanings.sent4: The backlots transformed into a magical forest for the movie.
meanings.sent5: The backlots were bustling with activity as the crew prepared for filming.

meanings.definition: A large area of land used for filming outdoor scenes for movies.
meanings.sent1: The backlots provided the perfect backdrop for the action-packed scene.
meanings.sent2: Many famous movies have been filmed on the backlots of major studios.
meanings.sent3: Visitors were amazed by the size of the backlots during the studio tour.
meanings.sent4: The backlots stretched out like a canvas waiting to be painted with movie magic.
meanings.sent5: The backlots offered endless possibilities for creating movie worlds.
